comments.author: mininow

comments.text:
A blow off valve releases all the boost preventing boost spike damage, but 
creates lag. Having no BOV means most of the boost is expelled but only a 
little bit remains, so you get no boost spike damage, and minimal lag.

comments.author: TheBk85

comments.text:
that turbo flutter (many call it choochoo including moog from mcm) is 
caused by the blades of the compressor side pushing air into a closed 
throttle plate. Pressure goes up, air tries to push back into the blades 
and you hear "choochoo". Wastegate is before the turbo and it regulates how 
much exhaust is actually passing through the turbo. If it makes any sound 
there's something wrong with it.

comments.text:
I would think that the added weight of two canisters of compressed oxygen 
would be well worth the extra load. One could set up the oxygen to spray 
into the throttle body at a pressure determined by the engine revs. The O2 
canisters would weigh about 90Kg and be a bit of extra load at the bottom 
of the track. Once they are set to inject oxygen at the 2000 meter altitude 
level and upwards the car would gain substantial performance. Worth trying 
at the very least.

comments.text: do you understand the only noise a wastegate makes is exhaust noise?
comments.author: equoowe

comments.text: lol no.
comments.author: 0Fab

comments.text:
Lol @ the noobs commenting about the off throttle noise. It's clearly 
turbocharged, and that sound is not the gearbox, it's not the wastegate, 
it's bot the blow off valve, or bypass valve. It's compressor surge, air 
moving from the turbo through the intercooler back our the turbo outlet 
when (or airbox, which I'm not entirely sure this Porsche is running one) 
when the driver shuts off the throttle. There, please stop leaving retarded 
replies now =]
comments.author: Big Alex

comments.text:
you really need to read up about turbos, no it does not make the turbo spin 
in the wrong direction, no it does not make excessive amounts of turbo lag 
and a wastegate lets exhaust gases bypass the turbo to control how much 
boost it makes, the only sound it can make is exhaust noise. the noise is 
from either the lack of a blow of valve or a blow of valve that doesn't 
release enough pressure, the noise is really just air being chopped up by 
the compressor blades.
comments.author: equoowe

comments.text:
no, i meant waste gates. the flutter noise is a back surge in pressure 
causing the turbine in the turbo to spin the wrong direction, this creates 
excessive amounts of turbo lag.
comments.author: wiltse0

comments.text:
it has a wastegate, maybe you mean blow off valve, they do 2 different 
things and one isn't needed.
